location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.18 of 1852, from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter enclosing a copy of a despatch (f 221) from Lt-Col Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, dated 19 December 1851, itself a covering letter enclosing the translation (ff 220-25) of a convention concluded with the Persian Government, lasting eleven years, allowing British and East India Company ships to search Persian vessels suspected of carrying slaves.
